bobby.engine.bobengine

Class NumberDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • bobby.engine.bobengine.GameObject
      • bobby.engine.bobengine.NumberDisplay

  • public class NumberDisplay
extends GameObject
    This class can be used to display an integer. The default font graphic is found in the res/drawable folder of the BobEngine library project with the name "numbers.png". You may copy it's format and create your own fonts. If you only have one font, simply name it "numbers.png" and put it in your project's res/drawable folder. Otherwise, use the function setGraphic() to change the font.
    Author:
    Ben

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(double x,
                double y,
                double sizeRatio,
                int layer)
        Set or Reset this NumberDisplay. You can specify position, size, and layer. The number that is displayed will be set to 0.
        Parameters:
        x - - x position in pixels
        y - - y position in pixels
        sizeRatio - - The width of a single digit relative to the width of the screen. The height is equal to the width in pixels. (ex: .25 would make the width of a single digit 1/4 the width of the screen)
        layer - - The z-depth of this GameObject in the Room.

      • setBeforeKerning

        public void setBeforeKerning(double d0,
                             double d1,
                             double d2,
                             double d3,
                             double d4,
                             double d5,
                             double d6,
                             double d7,
                             double d8,
                             double d9)
        Set the amount of empty space before digits. These values should be decimals representing percentages of the total width of the number graphic. (ex: .25 would take away 25% of the space in front of the digit.)
        Parameters:
        d0 - - Value for 0
        d1 - - Value for 1
        d2 - - So on...

        public void update(double deltaTime)
        Description copied from class: GameObject
        Update event that happens every frame. Super class method handles position updating, frame changing, and animation. You should override the step() method for game logic.

      • getVertices

        public float[] getVertices()
        Description copied from class: GameObject
        Gets the vertex data for drawing this object. Can be overriden for advanced purposes but be sure to also create getGraphic() and getIndices() overrides that match your getVertices() function.
        Overrides:
        getVertices in class GameObject
        Returns:
